Note: They have practiced Polygyny and secondary marriages.
Quote: Polygyny was permitted; sometimes a man would have as many as four wives, with separate housing for each wife.
Source: Theodoratus, D. J. (1971). Identity crises: changes in lifestyle of the Manchester Band of the Pomo Indians. University Microfilms. https://ehrafworldcultures.yale.edu/document?id=ns18-028
